admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Fertilizer Sector
            Restructuring Project for Indonesia were as follows:
            outcomes were unsatisfactory, project sustainability was
            uncertain, Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: well-defined policy measures including
            quantitative targets and timetables should have been agreed
            with the Government in the design stage. Implementation of
            the fertilizer policy statement should have addressed more
            fundamental issues such as full sector deregulation,
            competition development, and privatization. Coordination (or
            the lack of it), while being a classic issue, continues to
            be an important ingredient for policy implementation in a
            multi agency environment. In this context, a strong lead
            agency should have been agreed upon and appointed early in
            the design stage. Strong technical capability, as shown by
            the Participating Fertilizer Company (PFC), is of utmost
            importance in the implementation of an industry
            restructuring project that involves adding new production
            capacities and enhancing plant efficiency and productivity.
